itemDescription: English socialite and member of the Bright Young Things (1884-1950)

wikipedia_page.main: Frances Margaret Wodehouse, Countess of Kimberley (1 December 1884 - 4 January 1950) was an English socialite and member of the Bright Young Things. She married three times, always with members of the British aristocracy. She scandalized society when she went to live with her future second husband without waiting for her divorce to be effective.

response: Wodehouse was the son of John Wodehouse, 3rd Earl of Kimberley and Frances Margaret Irby, and succeeded to the earldom in 1941 when his father was killed in an air raid. He was educated at Eton and Magdalene College, Cambridge, and served with the Grenadier Guards in the Guards Armoured Division in 1943–45.Dod's Parliamentary Companion 1991, 172nd edition, Hurst Green, Sussex,p.172.
* Margaret Irby (1884–1950), English socialite, Countess of Kimberley
